allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add Contacts (LinkedIn Contacts) Networking Feature

Implemented a comprehensive LinkedIn contact management system to help users
categorize and track their professional network by interview opportunity potential.

Features:
- LinkedIn Connections CSV import with drag & drop
- Automatic contact categorization (High/Medium/Low Potential)
- Interactive contact management table with search and filtering
- Statistics dashboard showing contact distribution
- Inline editing for categories and notes
- Contact interaction tracking (optional)

Backend:
- New API routes: /api/ica/* for contact management
- LinkedIn CSV parser service with validation
- Database schema with 3 tables + statistics view
- Session-based contact isolation

Frontend:
- New "Networking" tab in main navigation
- Responsive UI matching JobMatch AI design
- Real-time category updates and statistics
- Search/filter functionality with debouncing

Database:
- linkedin_contacts table for contact storage
- contact_import_batches for upload tracking
- contact_interactions for networking history
- ica_stats view for aggregated statistics

Dependencies:
- csv-parse for CSV file parsing
- uuid, zod, pg for data handling

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
Bash(PGPASSWORD='npg_U1ZDnWkKoIj9' psql -h ep-quiet-heart-ahc56mo8-pooler.c-3.us-east-1.aws.neon.tech -U neondb_owner -d neondb -c "SELECT * FROM ica_stats;")

Bash(PGPASSWORD='npg_U1ZDnWkKoIj9' psql -h ep-quiet-heart-ahc56mo8-pooler.c-3.us-east-1.aws.neon.tech -U neondb_owner -d neondb -c "SELECT first_name, last_name, company FROM linkedin_contacts WHERE LOWER(first_name) LIKE ''%ash%'' OR LOWER(last_name) LIKE ''%ash%'' LIMIT 10;")

Bash(PGPASSWORD='npg_U1ZDnWkKoIj9' psql -h ep-quiet-heart-ahc56mo8-pooler.c-3.us-east-1.aws.neon.tech -U neondb_owner -d neondb -c "SELECT session_token, id FROM user_sessions ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 5;")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Redesign Find Jobs - Job URL Analyzer + Company Watchlist

MAJOR REDESIGN:
Complete overhaul of Find Jobs tab to make it actually useful for job seekers

NEW FEATURE 1: Job URL Analyzer
- Paste any job URL (LinkedIn, Indeed, company career page)
- Redirects to Analyze tab with URL pre-filled
- Get instant match score, gap analysis, referrals
- One workflow: Find job â†’ Paste URL â†’ Analyze â†’ Save

NEW FEATURE 2: Company Watchlist  
- Track 10-20 target companies in one place
- Add companies: Google, Microsoft, Amazon, etc.
- Each card shows "View Connections" button
- Instantly see your LinkedIn referrals at each company
- Persisted in localStorage

WHAT''S PRESERVED (No Breaking Changes):
- Legacy resume upload still available (hidden by default)
- Click "Or upload resume to search" to access old workflow
- All existing profile extraction code intact
- Job search with external links still works
- Analyze, Tracker, Networking tabs unchanged

WHY THIS IS BETTER:
OLD APPROACH (Useless):
- Generated fake sample jobs
- No real job data
- External links to Google searches
- Not helpful for actual job hunting

NEW APPROACH (Useful):
- Works with real jobs you found
- Analyze any job posting instantly
- Strategic company targeting
- Referral discovery built-in
- Organized watchlist of target companies

TECHNICAL:
- Company watchlist stored in localStorage
- renderWatchlist() displays company cards
- addToWatchlist() / removeFromWatchlist() CRUD operations
- Job URL analyzer redirects to Analyze tab
- All existing event listeners and APIs preserved

USER WORKFLOW:
1. Find job on LinkedIn/Indeed
2. Copy URL â†’ Paste in Find Jobs
3. Analyze match score + find referrals
4. Save to Tracker
5. Add company to watchlist for future monitoring

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
